Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hit a walk-off grand slam in the ninth inning
Virat Kohli completed a second successive fifty off the 34th ball he faced
KL Rahul's catch by Ryan Burl is the best of the match so far
Pre-Game Insights: India qualified earlier today, when South Africa went down to Netherlands
Pakistan have now snuck into the semi final
If India beat Zimbabwe, they top the table and face England; if they lose, they take on New Zealand in the semis
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav is deservedly player of the match
Virat Kohli reclaimed his position atop the tournament runscorer charts
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tendai Chatara c & b Patel 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 100
Sikandar Raza and Ryan Burl have put on a superb 50-run partnership
Craig Ervine chips Hardik Pandya back to the bowler, with Pandya backtracking to hold a gently catch over his head in the seventh over
Tony Munyonga gets hit by a Shami yorker, is given out, then reviews, but sees that the ball is crashing into leg
Madhevere follows it and Virat Kohli takes an excellent diving catch at short cover, diving low to his right
Regis Chakabva's bat and pad, and hits timber
Ryan Burl dives to get both hands to one that was hit exceedingly flat and hard. Wonderful piece of catching
Others: India chose to bat, by the way, folks. And as Rishabh Pant has not had a game yet this tournament, he is in for Dinesh Karthik.
Zimbabwe are bringing in left-arm spinner Wellington Masakadza, and offspin-bowling allrounder Tony Munyonga. Milton Shunga and Luke Jongwe make way.
